abstract: McGraw-Hill Companies has been the target of some harsh criticism lately, in large part because of the rosy ratings that its Standard & Poor’s unit gave to assets that now look radioactive. (An S&P analyst’s e-mail about rating deals “structured by cows” didn’t help on that score.)
